Key:
(Man, time really flies when you have after-school
duties. Rinne said she'd head home before me so she
could get dinner ready, so I guess I'm good.)
(Hm? Did someone just come out of the house...?)
Ah, Yoshino. I knew it was you. I'm home.
Oh... Welcome home, Shido-san.
Welcome home Shido-kun. We were just on our way\nout. Bumping into one another like this... Could it be\nfate?
On your way out? Where are you guys going?
U-Um... I was heading toward the station to, um...
We were just on our way to go meet...
Meet? Meet who?

Hehehe... Seems like there is an unwanted guest that
has interfered with our dark encounter.
Ah, Kaguya's with you, huh? Then I'm not worried.
Um, Shido-san... Would you like to join us?
Me too?

Oh, do you dare? We are about to embark on a journey
to seal the god of boredom, and witness a ceremony
to view the box of memory... The truth of truth.
Truth of truth?
Kaguya-chan is just being mysterious. She's talking\nabout a movie.
How did you get that, Yoshinon?
Well I'm close to Kaguya-chan and Yuzuru-chan, so\nthis is nothing. What are you going to do, Shido-kun?\nDo you want to come? Join us?
Hm... I guess I'll take you up on your offer.
Amazing, Shido-kun, you totally get it! Let's go, go,\ngo together!
As my servant, it's only natural... Follow me!
I'm happy that you're joining us, Shido-san...
Yeah. I can't wait for the movie.
Yeah!

Oh, seems like it's not too crowded. There aren't
too many people around. I think we can watch in
peace.
Yes. I'm so glad.

Hopefully we won't end up having to listen to any
rowdy people watching the movie. Let's be quiet
ourselves and hope for the best.
O-Okay... I'll try my best...
Ahhh, can't wait.

I sense a heavy darkness swelling inside... Hehehe.
I cannot wait.

Kaguya. I know you know this, but be sure to be quiet
during the movie, okay? Follow Yoshino?
Shut up! That's none of your concern!
Well, that's fine. Let's go in, then.
Okay...!

(It was a fantasy movie where an evil demon who had
been sealed away was resurrected. It was defeated by
the chosen hero.)

(During the movie, Yoshino and Kaguya were enthralled.
Luckily, their reactions weren't too out of control.)

(The movie seemed to be based on a famous fantasy
novel and left many potential hooks for a sequel.)

(Although there were a few cliffhangers, the movie
drew me in as well, and I was totally immersed in it.
I would say for certain that it was a good watch.)

(As we lingered in the theater, the sequel preview
began to play. After watching it, I was so curious to
know what happens next.)
Man that sure was a good movie.

Yes, it was pleasant to the eye. Ah, the ceremony of
darkness... You have led me down a worthy path.

Haha, I bet. How did you guys like it, Yoshino?
Yoshinon?
Yeah, it was totally fun. It was worth coming!
Yeah. How about you, Yoshino?
Hey, Yoshino?
YOSHINO. The movie is over.
Huh...? Oh... S-Sorry!

I can see why you'd want to hang around here. It was
really fun.
...Yes.
Oh, there's a perfect spot for us over there.

(Kaguya confidently pointed to a corner of the lobby.
I looked over and there was...)

Oh, a special kiosk for the movie. You want to check
it out?
Oh...! Yes, I want to go!
Then let's hurry on over!

No matter the burdens on your shoulders, there is
power in the quest for an answer, the Answer road!
The power is in effect, for even this―
Hey! Wait for me!

(The special kiosk had a movie-themed display. Yoshino
stood in front of it.)

This is the hero's sword and the fortune teller's
crystal. These are so well-made...
Yes, they look like the real ones from the movie.

Hehehe. You foolish servants. You can't tell just by
looking?
What are you talking about...?

Do you not get it? The grand magic that is being
stored in the crystal ball!

(Well, it's true that the movie plot centered around
the power that took over the protagonist's life,
but...)

This is the magic that should have resided in the
protagonist. Because of this crystal's existence, he
became the last trump card against the demon.

Huh... Oh! It's true. The protagonist was the last
hope in defeating the demon... The protagonist
became "the child of fate"... thanks to the crystal?

Hehe... Exactly! The evil Ancient goddess created the
crystal in her place. It's one of the eternal dark
relics hidden away in the darkness of history.
Uh, Kaguya... That's a bit far-fetched...

You stay out of this, Shido! See, the demon's curse
resides in the crystal through the protagonist. The
hero's "protection" became the demon's other heart.
...Its other heart.

(I figured Kaguya didn't read the novel. This was a
backstory that Kaguya completely made up. Yoshino
looks like she's totally buying it.)
(This isn't going to end well later...)

However, God had spun the threads of fate to overcome
even that. It is in front of you now, right Yoshino?
The holy sword... Stardust Overture...

Exactly. Therein lies the power to fulfill your desires,
drawn from the audience to create an infinite prism.
Resound the bells of Ragnarok to destroy all evil!
Whoa...
"It's a replica. Just a fake."...Or so they thought.\nBut they were wrong.
Amazing...
It is amazing... but Kaguya-chan, is it really real?
O-Of course! I-I would never lie?!
Yeah, you would.
You're totally lying～!
H-Hey, what gives?! I told you, I'm not lying!
Because you obviously look guilty.
T-Totally not true! Shido, you have me all wrong!

...It's true, though. I feel like I can sense some
powers.
Y-Yoshino?
The sword... is reacting to my emotions...?

Oh, um, Yoshino? That's just the ray of the sunset
coming in through the window...
Wow... What you said was true, Kaguya-san.

H-Hmph! Of course it is! With my powers, it's only
natural!

(She's completely losing the opportunity to back
out of it...)
Kaguya.
Wh-What is it... Shido.

I don't think you should be saying, "Of course it is!
What are you going to do now? Yoshino is totally
believing you!"

Oh, uh... That's... I have no idea what you're talking
about...

You're the one who made this up. You'd better come
clean, or Yoshino will be hurt.
...*Grunt*! Okay...
H-Hey, Yoshino?

As you said Kaguya-san... This is the real one. With
special powers...

Well, you know... it's...? I may have overexaggerated.
Or rather, the one here doesn't have such powers....

But... You're amazing, Kaguya-san. You can tell just
by looking at it.

Well, um... That was... I just blurted it out, or rather...
It was a joke...
I respect you, Kaguya-san!

I see, I see! You're my amazing servant. You know
what's up. Hahahahahaha!

Kaguya... You made it even worse, so I'm not going to
help you out of this one. Like I said before, you'd
better explain it to her before we get home, okay?

Aw, what?! I'm sorry! I was wrong, so don't abandon
me!

(As we left the movie theater, we explained to Yoshino
that it was just a joke, and by the time we got back
home, Yoshino was finally able to understand.)
Aren't you lucky that Yoshino understood?
*Whimper*... I'm sorry...

(We just had Yoshino settle by promising that we'd
watch the next movie with her, but I had a sense that
we'd need to watch what Kaguya said in the future.)
